commit_message:
Config options: centralize iser libvirt options (11)

The config options of the "nova.conf" section "libvirt" got
moved to the new central location "nova/conf/libvirt.py".
Subsequent patches will then move another options in libvirt section.
This is the 11th patch in a long-chain patchs.

Change-Id: I879d668f95f507ca193fad2d21a9465c3b3a2062
Co-Authored-by: Markus Zoeller <mzoeller@de.ibm.com>
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

subject: Add hint info in resume error message
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 10:24:45.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': 'Add hint info in resume error message

For the situation:
Stack Create -> Stack Suspend -> Stack Check -> Stack Resume
stack resume will fail for State (u'CHECK', u'COMPLETE') invalid for resume.

We can do like this under this situation :
Stack Create -> Stack Suspend -> Stack Check -> Stack Resume
-> Stack Suspend -> Stack Resume

So, This change added the hint info to tell user that
"you must execute action-suspend first and then execute action-resume."

Change-Id: I28a19c366aed3d810b201cb758a7abb544177188
Closes-Bug: #1506042
'}]
commit_message:
Add hint info in resume error message

For the situation:
Stack Create -> Stack Suspend -> Stack Check -> Stack Resume
stack resume will fail for State (u'CHECK', u'COMPLETE') invalid for resume.

We can do like this under this situation :
Stack Create -> Stack Suspend -> Stack Check -> Stack Resume
-> Stack Suspend -> Stack Resume

So, This change added the hint info to tell user that
"you must execute action-suspend first and then execute action-resume."

Change-Id: I28a19c366aed3d810b201cb758a7abb544177188
Closes-Bug: #1506042

commit_message:
Don't use two different names for the same flag

The nested_abandon_in_progress flag in the StackResource class is used in
exactly the same way and does exactly the same thing as the
abandon_in_progress flag does in every other Resource class, except that it
does the Wrong Thing when adopting a stack fails.

Change-Id: I47e412169f58734b8684a645470180d95e13def6

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-05-06 03:42:15.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/common/clientmanager.py'], 'message': 'Ignore domain related config when using with keystone v2

Currently, "/usr/bin/openstack --insecure token issue"
fails when OS_AUTH_URL and OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION
indicate keystone v2 if OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME or
OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME are set. This patchset ignore domain
related configs if using with keystone v2.

Change-Id: If7eea2ed1a4877c60d055ed0114a5e5f31e282a0
Closes-bug: #1447704
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore domain related config when using with keystone v2

Currently, "/usr/bin/openstack --insecure token issue"
fails when OS_AUTH_URL and OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION
indicate keystone v2 if OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME or
OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME are set. This patchset ignore domain
related configs if using with keystone v2.

Change-Id: If7eea2ed1a4877c60d055ed0114a5e5f31e282a0
Closes-bug: #1447704

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-21 22:01:52.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/tests/contrib/post_test_hook.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Disable nova quota for dsvm functional test

Parallel execution of tacker functional test ends up
creating lots of VMs and eventually fails hitting the
default max instance of 10. This fix disables quota for
tacker functional test suite. However gate VMs still has
upper constraint on resources like 8GB max limit. To avoid
tripping the actual gate VM resource limit reduce concurrency
to a lower number (2).

Change-Id: I3fe8c012b85554fa21b5b4b64378d68e3d979cc2
Closes-Bug: #1572420
'}]
commit_message:
Disable nova quota for dsvm functional test

Parallel execution of tacker functional test ends up
creating lots of VMs and eventually fails hitting the
default max instance of 10. This fix disables quota for
tacker functional test suite. However gate VMs still has
upper constraint on resources like 8GB max limit. To avoid
tripping the actual gate VM resource limit reduce concurrency
to a lower number (2).

Change-Id: I3fe8c012b85554fa21b5b4b64378d68e3d979cc2
Closes-Bug: #1572420

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-19 15:52:04.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/contrib/admin_actions.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_admin_actions.py'], 'message': 'Cleanup volume_attachment in case of reset-state attach_status

We have the ability to use reset-state to get the volume back
to a usable state, but current reset-state only changes
status, attach_status and migration_status for volume 'table'
of target volume.
This means target volume entry in the 'volume_attachment' table
keeps remaining even after resetting attach_status.
When the volume will be attached again, multiple instances
will be shown in "Attached to" of "cinder list" unexpectedly.

This patch adds a cleanup for volume_attachment of target
volume when attach_status equals 'detached'.

Change-Id: Ibd403ececffe5d10eff68304ba82f55ed7d43975
Closes-Bug: #1568034
(cherry picked from commit ea19c4a5431c445e7199a64062210188dd2b0137)
Conflicts:
    cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_admin_actions.py
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup volume_attachment in case of reset-state attach_status

We have the ability to use reset-state to get the volume back
to a usable state, but current reset-state only changes
status, attach_status and migration_status for volume 'table'
of target volume.
This means target volume entry in the 'volume_attachment' table
keeps remaining even after resetting attach_status.
When the volume will be attached again, multiple instances
will be shown in "Attached to" of "cinder list" unexpectedly.

This patch adds a cleanup for volume_attachment of target
volume when attach_status equals 'detached'.

Change-Id: Ibd403ececffe5d10eff68304ba82f55ed7d43975
Closes-Bug: #1568034
(cherry picked from commit ea19c4a5431c445e7199a64062210188dd2b0137)
Conflicts:
    cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_admin_actions.py

commit_message:
Do not use network_api_class option

network_api_class is deprecated in Neutron and will be removed.
Set use_neutron to true as nova::network::neutron is a Neutron-specific class,
network_api_class parameter becomes useless and doesn't take any effect

Closes-Bug: #1567157
Change-Id: Ifc1b569c21e3bff6d160c8c5ac28895de28e6370
(cherry picked from commit 3201927ce35c1c64b502ab27f8d9083d6c8a65a3)

commit_message:
Add snapshot_metadata operations to policy.json

These snapshot_metadata APIs are not enforced by
the cinder policy.json file. This patch adds
policy and the code to support applying this
policy action.

 "volume:get_snapshot_metadata": "rule:admin_or_owner",
 "volume:delete_snapshot_metadata": "rule:admin_or_owner",
 "volume:update_snapshot_metadata": "rule:admin_or_owner",

Change-Id: I8c0ef554e71c008cacd610eee9767173dfcca082
Closes-bug: #1578829

subject: SSH: add SocatConsole class
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 659, 'name': 'Akira Yoshiyama', 'email': 'akirayoshiyama@gmail.com', 'username': 'yosshy'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 7882, 'name': 'Yuiko Takada Mori', 'email': 'yuiko-mori@nec.com', 'username': 'YuikoTakada'}, {'_account_id': 17998, 'name': 'UFCG OneView CI', 'email': 'ufcg-oneview-ci@lsd.ufcg.edu.br', 'username': 'ufcg-oneview-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20311, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ironic_ci@external.cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ironic_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-03-29 11:27:52.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/drivers/test_agent.py', 'releasenotes/notes/add-socat-console-ssh-25e3ee58db851dc7.yaml', 'ironic/drivers/agent.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_ssh.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ssh.py', 'ironic/drivers/fake.py', 'ironic/drivers/pxe.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/test_pxe.py'], 'message': 'SSH: add SocatConsole class

SocatConsole is a new console driver class using virsh and socat. It
has the same APIs of ShellinaboxConsole class and provides
TCP4/TCP6/SSL connection service to connect virtual console of nodes.

And get_console_driver() selects one of ShellinaboxConsole() and
SocatConsole(), depends on CONF.console.terminal.

- CONF.console.terminal contains "shellinaboxd":
   get_console_driver() returns ShellinaboxConsole()
- CONF.console.terminal contains "socat":
   get_console_driver() returns SocatConsole()
- Other cases (default):
   get_console_driver() returns ShellinaboxConsole()

Partial-Bug: #1553083
Change-Id: I5467fba6552d0e63d41abe297f82655243517845
'}]
commit_message:
SSH: add SocatConsole class

SocatConsole is a new console driver class using virsh and socat. It
has the same APIs of ShellinaboxConsole class and provides
TCP4/TCP6/SSL connection service to connect virtual console of nodes.

And get_console_driver() selects one of ShellinaboxConsole() and
SocatConsole(), depends on CONF.console.terminal.

- CONF.console.terminal contains "shellinaboxd":
   get_console_driver() returns ShellinaboxConsole()
- CONF.console.terminal contains "socat":
   get_console_driver() returns SocatConsole()
- Other cases (default):
   get_console_driver() returns ShellinaboxConsole()

Partial-Bug: #1553083
Change-Id: I5467fba6552d0e63d41abe297f82655243517845

commit_message:
console utils: add methods for serial console with socat

This commit adds 3 methods to use socat below:

- get_socat_console_url(port)
    returns an URL for clients
- start_socat_console(node_uuid, port, console_cmd)
    runs socat for a specified command
- stop_socat_console(node_uuid)
    stops a running socat process

Each has the same API as one for shellinabox.
And 2 parameters are added:

- terminal_cert_file (str)
  specifies the .pem file containing its ceritificate and private key.
- terminal_ca_file (str)
  the .crt file containing the certificate of the peer.

Partial-Bug: #1553083
Change-Id: Icec2ec20590d5ead561ce9559c9bb7ab96b3c0ce

commit_message:
Ironic: add get_serial_console()

Finally, ironic got a capability to export remote serial console
via TCP/SSL connection. This patch adds get_serial_console() to use
it with nova-serialproxy.

NOTE: nova-serialproxy currently supports only TCP sockets.

Partial-Bug: #1553083
Depends-On: 55aa693f1f242b5d0edfb44bc1d8d5f5f6b5ac98
Change-Id: Ie24baedb80d43d0587f3f4f332cb0d97cf9f55ec

subject: Use TinyIPA and iPXE for most Ironic jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-06 22:53:23.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': "Use TinyIPA and iPXE for most Ironic jobs

Unless there's a good reason to do otherwise, we want to use TinyIPA
(smaller ram footprint, faster boot times) and iPXE (uses http for all
transfers, reducing random failures due to network issues) for all
Ironic jobs.

With tinyipa being the default ramdisk for the Ironic tempest jobs, we
now gate IPA on both tinyipa and coreos ramdisks, to prevent breakage to
a single ramdisk being merged into IPA.

This follows the pattern expected of IPA->Ironic job interaction: IPA
gates on all possible supported ramdisks, then Ironic uses the one best
suited to CI to test all jobs, with IPA gate jobs ensuring that no
changes go in that break a single ramdisk.

Change-Id: I834f2b9d63260a4ae67a0b5d9a203cb7824e54ba
"}]
commit_message:
Use TinyIPA and iPXE for most Ironic jobs

Unless there's a good reason to do otherwise, we want to use TinyIPA
(smaller ram footprint, faster boot times) and iPXE (uses http for all
transfers, reducing random failures due to network issues) for all
Ironic jobs.

With tinyipa being the default ramdisk for the Ironic tempest jobs, we
now gate IPA on both tinyipa and coreos ramdisks, to prevent breakage to
a single ramdisk being merged into IPA.

This follows the pattern expected of IPA->Ironic job interaction: IPA
gates on all possible supported ramdisks, then Ironic uses the one best
suited to CI to test all jobs, with IPA gate jobs ensuring that no
changes go in that break a single ramdisk.

Change-Id: I834f2b9d63260a4ae67a0b5d9a203cb7824e54ba

commit_message:
Return BadRequest for 4 byte unicode characters

Various create and update apis are returning 500 error
when you pass 4 byte unicode characters in the request.

This patch fixes the issue to return HTTP 400 Bad Request.

1. md-namespace-create
2. md-namespace-update
3. md-property-create
4. md-property-update
5. md-object-create
6. md-object-update
7. md-tag-create
8. md-tag-update

APIImpact: For all of the above APIs, it will return 400 error instead
of 500 if user passes 4 byte unicode characters in the request.

Closes-Bug: #1570789
Change-Id:  I8233cf95310aa2671ebc62995c58208024fc38a3

commit_message:
Force bashate to use python2.7

tox defaults to whatever version of python tox itself was run under.

bashate fails when run under python3, so force the bashate testenv to
use python2.7, regardless of the tox default.

For posterity, the py3 failure is:
[...]
File ".../devstack/.tox/bashate/lib/python3.5/site-packages/bashate/bashate.py", line 279, in check_files
    check_syntax(fname, report)
File ".../devstack/.tox/bashate/lib/python3.5/site-packages/bashate/bashate.py", line 179, in check_syntax
    for line in outputs[1].split('\n'):
TypeError: a bytes-like object is required, not 'str'

Change-Id: Ic91b5ce8cb85e376573f9bf3659d2a86cc437179

commit_message:
DRBD: extend volume if larger than snapshot

Extend volume if during create_volume_from_snapshot() the new volume
is larger than the snapshot it was created from. Moved resize checks
and calls from create_cloned_volume() to create_volume_from_snapshot()
to reuse code.

Extended and added new test cases to cover the change.

Closes-Bug: #1560636

Change-Id: I16c93ce272320a72964ea2f8727b3f0fb24149f7
Signed-off-by: Danny Al-Gaaf <danny.al-gaaf@bisect.de>

commit_message:

when creating an artifact.

commit_message:
Fix index check when replacing blob items in artifacts

Glance should validate which items in blob list we can replace:
the index of the item should less than blob_list size and
index value should be positive.
The patch adds this check to artifact implementation.
In addition some small refactoring of _upload_list_property
method was mage to improve code clarity.

Change-Id: I52877af9ff50be90c684bee43effae567374008b
Closes-bug: #1493833

commit_message:
Fix replacing of item in blob list

When specifying a new value for existing item in blob list glance
didn't check if this value already exists and we need to clear it.
The patch fixes this and alows Glance to clean up blob item in
list before update.

FastTrack
Change-Id: I947a67c0ff32dae07ff5d921dee22da16116c4ce
Closes-bug: #1491823

Glance executes blob delete if the current blob does exist

If the new blob value is None then Glance just deletes blob

commit_message:
Support replacing of blobs in artifacts

The patch adds support of updating existing blobs in Glance.
Glance executes blob delete if the current blob does exist
and uploads a new blob after that.
If the new blob value is None then Glance just deletes blob
from Glance.
The patch also fixes incorrect attribute usage in exceptions
that will be raising by Glance when deleting a blob from store.

FastTrack
Closes-bug: #1493826
Change-Id: Iff44304dac92b4663f9800300dca7ab631f87b9f

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-24 13:11:22.000000000', 'files': ['etc/glance-api.conf', 'doc/source/configuring.rst', 'etc/glance-registry.conf'], 'message': "Sheepdog: Fix default sheepdog_store_address of glance-api.conf

The string of sheepdog_store_address is used by dog command
to specify the IP address of the sheep server.

In addition, dog command can't handle hostname and can handle
the strings of IP address only.

Previously the entry was 'localhost' and dog command couldn't handle it.
To fix this the glance_store has been updated to change the default to '127.0.0.1'.

So, this patch changes the documentation from 'localhost' to '127.0.0.1' to
reflect the glance_store change.

Change-Id: I601233fb75e2737a02e7af25a59062d26b31d994
Depends-On: I28ea18badcb4a47daece5efed38d53fc35870902
"}]
commit_message:
Sheepdog: Fix default sheepdog_store_address of glance-api.conf

The string of sheepdog_store_address is used by dog command
to specify the IP address of the sheep server.

In addition, dog command can't handle hostname and can handle
the strings of IP address only.

Previously the entry was 'localhost' and dog command couldn't handle it.
To fix this the glance_store has been updated to change the default to '127.0.0.1'.

So, this patch changes the documentation from 'localhost' to '127.0.0.1' to
reflect the glance_store change.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I601233fb75e2737a02e7af25a59062d26b31d994
Depends-On: I28ea18badcb4a47daece5efed38d53fc35870902

subject: Tighten up testing for sloppy auth version
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-05 14:29:12.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_shell.py'], 'message': 'Tighten up testing for sloppy auth version

The existing test that os-identity-api-version=2 would
result in the correct auth_version=2.0 (note 2 -> 2.0)
does not verify the sloppy version handling code path.
When auth, key and user options are all missing the
auth version is always set to 2.0 so the test will always
pass. Adding auth, key and user options to the test command
will cause the test to verify that the os-identity-api-version
option was used and mapped to 2.0.

Change-Id: Ifa10cd2b8bf81c082d5e3fa846f993871194fea0
'}]
commit_message:
Tighten up testing for sloppy auth version

The existing test that os-identity-api-version=2 would
result in the correct auth_version=2.0 (note 2 -> 2.0)
does not verify the sloppy version handling code path.
When auth, key and user options are all missing the
auth version is always set to 2.0 so the test will always
pass. Adding auth, key and user options to the test command
will cause the test to verify that the os-identity-api-version
option was used and mapped to 2.0.

Change-Id: Ifa10cd2b8bf81c082d5e3fa846f993871194fea0

commit_message:
VMware: Unit test refactoring

There are unit tests which test multiple code paths and methods.
This patch refactors the unit tests for the following methods in
the vmdk module to fix this:
* copy_volume_to_image
* _in_use
* retype

Change-Id: I8b86896e90a89d0c60f54c6b2a9ea3eda1841e9b

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-19 09:15:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/service.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_service.py'], 'message': "Fix service version pinning on start

When a service starts (c-sch, c-bak, c-vol) they set the versions for
the RPC client and serializer using existing Service entries in the DB,
but they don't consider themselves when determining the minimum version.

By not considering themselves we have 2 problematic scenarios:

1- When a service is first started it will pin to None version since
there are no Services in the DB 2- When a service is upgraded and
restarted it will pin to the old version since the entry in the DB has
not been updated yet.

The problem is that Service.__init__ creates the service manager, which
in turn creates required RPC API instances, and it is at this point that
the pinning happens without the presence of this service DB entry.

This patch fixes this by moving the creation of the DB entry from the
Service.start method to the Service.__init__ method that gets called
from Service.create method.

There was an alternative solution, but it was more intrusive since it
required changes not only to Service.start but also to all managers
(since each one create different instances RPC APIs.

Closes-Bug: #1569299
Change-Id: I21f8e81d9923f44b22cc43c9c173bc560a93c631
(cherry picked from commit 7efb2c6267417d27938d16712bf0704a2e5f25df)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix service version pinning on start

When a service starts (c-sch, c-bak, c-vol) they set the versions for
the RPC client and serializer using existing Service entries in the DB,
but they don't consider themselves when determining the minimum version.

By not considering themselves we have 2 problematic scenarios:

1- When a service is first started it will pin to None version since
there are no Services in the DB 2- When a service is upgraded and
restarted it will pin to the old version since the entry in the DB has
not been updated yet.

The problem is that Service.__init__ creates the service manager, which
in turn creates required RPC API instances, and it is at this point that
the pinning happens without the presence of this service DB entry.

This patch fixes this by moving the creation of the DB entry from the
Service.start method to the Service.__init__ method that gets called
from Service.create method.

There was an alternative solution, but it was more intrusive since it
required changes not only to Service.start but also to all managers
(since each one create different instances RPC APIs.

Closes-Bug: #1569299
Change-Id: I21f8e81d9923f44b22cc43c9c173bc560a93c631
(cherry picked from commit 7efb2c6267417d27938d16712bf0704a2e5f25df)

commit_message:
Config options: centralize vif libvirt options (6)

The config options of the "nova.conf" section "libvirt" got
moved to the new central location "nova/conf/libvirt.py".
Subsequent patches will then move another options in libvirt section.
This is the 6th patch in a long-chain patchs.

Change-Id: I9c182f49711a54e140c6321aa56c72850bc4d1a3
Co-Authored-by: Markus Zoeller <mzoeller@de.ibm.com>
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

revisions:

Current codebas use setup_package installing networking-ovn to /usr/lib,
it is difficult to develop and unlike other openstack project(nova,
neutron).

Switch to use setup_develop, which create a link to
/opt/stack/networking-ovn insead of installing it:

        /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking-ovn.egg-link

Change-Id: I19863b663e7b5af5e0d606c2d6489acceb23fe45
Closes-Bug: #1579453
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to use  setup_develop of devstack

Current codebas use setup_package installing networking-ovn to /usr/lib,
it is difficult to develop and unlike other openstack project(nova,
neutron).

Switch to use setup_develop, which create a link to
/opt/stack/networking-ovn insead of installing it:

        /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking-ovn.egg-link

Change-Id: I19863b663e7b5af5e0d606c2d6489acceb23fe45
Closes-Bug: #1579453

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-18 08:58:12.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/deprecate_ovs_use_veth-6336f10f38001106.yaml', 'neutron/agent/linux/interface.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/common/config.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Deprecate 'ovs_use_veth' and 'veth_mtu' options"

The reason for reverting this is that when we tested this OVS
port is show as DOWN and it can actually send traffic.

An explanation is below:

The DHCP port has "tap" in the name, but doesn't appear to be
a tap device. It appears to be an OVS internal device. That device
was then put into a different network namespace, which isn't
visible to the root namespace in which ovs-vswitchd is running.
Using internal devices in this manor is kind of a hack since
ovs-vswitchd can't actually see the device, but it can still
send and receive traffic on it.

This reverts commit 850b4c025fa5652bfa474c78e7775d74fdb93df6.

Closes-bug: #1571553
Change-Id: I82d53d62bfd42cb17e3ce7f739369be3bbf44c02
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Deprecate 'ovs_use_veth' and 'veth_mtu' options"

The reason for reverting this is that when we tested this OVS
port is show as DOWN and it can actually send traffic.

An explanation is below:

The DHCP port has "tap" in the name, but doesn't appear to be
a tap device. It appears to be an OVS internal device. That device
was then put into a different network namespace, which isn't
visible to the root namespace in which ovs-vswitchd is running.
Using internal devices in this manor is kind of a hack since
ovs-vswitchd can't actually see the device, but it can still
send and receive traffic on it.

This reverts commit 850b4c025fa5652bfa474c78e7775d74fdb93df6.

Closes-bug: #1571553
Change-Id: I82d53d62bfd42cb17e3ce7f739369be3bbf44c02

revisions:

'}]
commit_message:
is-empty conditions should accept missing values

Returning False from is-empty condition on missing values seems extremely
confusing and rules out some potential use cases.

Closes-Bug: #1578184
Change-Id: I8f976516f89367512e2ffae2815085be1776b6f6

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-05 20:07:23.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/image/image_utils.py'], 'message': "WIP: Add image_conversion_cache_mode config for qemu-img

This patch adds a new config image_conversion_cache_mode
parameter to pass cache mode for 'qemu-img convert'.
By default, qemu-img doesn't use cache during image
conversion, but in some backends who can't handle write
same scsi command with unmap flag hit following error
during volume zero clear before writing converted image.

This config provides alternate options for them.

ERROR: qemu-img: error writing zeroes at sector 0:
Input/output error

Change-Id: I732ab2e37f9969ba50e93f46cc06e95253ae231f
Closes-Bug: #1531711
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Add image_conversion_cache_mode config for qemu-img

This patch adds a new config image_conversion_cache_mode
parameter to pass cache mode for 'qemu-img convert'.
By default, qemu-img doesn't use cache during image
conversion, but in some backends who can't handle write
same scsi command with unmap flag hit following error
during volume zero clear before writing converted image.

This config provides alternate options for them.

ERROR: qemu-img: error writing zeroes at sector 0:
Input/output error

Change-Id: I732ab2e37f9969ba50e93f46cc06e95253ae231f
Closes-Bug: #1531711

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-04-14 17:12:43.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/manager.py', 'manila/share/driver.py', 'manila/tests/share/test_manager.py'], 'message': "Fix Share status when driver migrates

If a driver implements optimized migration, share status is stuck
'migrating' and task state is stuck 'migration_in_progress' if
2-phase migration is not used. This change addresses it by properly
setting the task state and status for this specific scenario.
This change also adds 'host' to model update performed by manager,
to prevent confusion related to drivers having to return such
value in their model update or not.

Change-Id: I4b2c1b02771d8bbb6a8d3ca2719186ad41e5d9af
Closes-bug: #1563823
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Share status when driver migrates

If a driver implements optimized migration, share status is stuck
'migrating' and task state is stuck 'migration_in_progress' if
2-phase migration is not used. This change addresses it by properly
setting the task state and status for this specific scenario.
This change also adds 'host' to model update performed by manager,
to prevent confusion related to drivers having to return such
value in their model update or not.

Change-Id: I4b2c1b02771d8bbb6a8d3ca2719186ad41e5d9af
Closes-bug: #1563823

subject: Fix handling of NOVA_COMPUTE_RESTART
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-23 17:38:28.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/scripts/test/launch_instance_private_net.sh'], 'message': "Fix handling of NOVA_COMPUTE_RESTART

In launch_instance_private_net, NOVA_COMPUTE_RESTART is supposed to
count nova-compute restarts. Since the variable is changed in a
subshell, the changes don't get passed back to the caller.

This patch addresses the issue by printing out the problem as soon
as it arises.

Change-Id: Idbaec93b516f0bd19cced743310b064c101bf732
"}]
commit_message:
Fix handling of NOVA_COMPUTE_RESTART

In launch_instance_private_net, NOVA_COMPUTE_RESTART is supposed to
count nova-compute restarts. Since the variable is changed in a
subshell, the changes don't get passed back to the caller.

This patch addresses the issue by printing out the problem as soon
as it arises.

Change-Id: Idbaec93b516f0bd19cced743310b064c101bf732

commit_message:
Code improvements suggested by shellcheck

- use $* instead of $@ where appropriate
- quote strings to prevent globbing and word splitting
- omit $ in front of variables within $(( ))
- use grep -c instead of grep | wc -l
- remove unused variables
- unquote right-hand side of =~ operator

Change-Id: If898193ef35a7db245e34ec133126c92c17c51c2

subject: Replace loop device with real block device
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-24 10:12:46.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/lib/osbash/virtualbox-install_nodes.sh', 'labs/osbash/config/config.compute1', 'labs/osbash/lib/osbash/kvm-install_nodes.sh', 'labs/osbash/scripts/ubuntu/setup_cinder_volumes.sh', 'labs/osbash/lib/osbash/virtualbox-functions.sh'], 'message': 'Replace loop device with real block device

This patch adds a new configuration option SECOND_DISK_SIZE for node VM
configuration files. If set, a block device of the given size is created
and attached to the VM (typically to become /dev/sdb).

This new option is used by setup_cinder_volumes, replacing the previous
method which used loop devices. The new client-side code now matches the
install-guide in this regard and is also easier to read.

Change-Id: I16b6a569d19676d7fff07592bd41bc71fa7c3ae2
'}]
commit_message:
Replace loop device with real block device

This patch adds a new configuration option SECOND_DISK_SIZE for node VM
configuration files. If set, a block device of the given size is created
and attached to the VM (typically to become /dev/sdb).

This new option is used by setup_cinder_volumes, replacing the previous
method which used loop devices. The new client-side code now matches the
install-guide in this regard and is also easier to read.

Change-Id: I16b6a569d19676d7fff07592bd41bc71fa7c3ae2

subject: Wait longer for KVM to come up with base VM
revisions:

On some systems (observed on Fedora 22), five seconds may not be long
enough for the base VM to come up and be ready to accept keyboard input.

This patch increases the time from 5 to 10 seconds.

Change-Id: Ia43dae20ae037cca691971ce6af71ba9af64df07
'}]
commit_message:
Wait longer for KVM to come up with base VM

On some systems (observed on Fedora 22), five seconds may not be long
enough for the base VM to come up and be ready to accept keyboard input.

This patch increases the time from 5 to 10 seconds.

Change-Id: Ia43dae20ae037cca691971ce6af71ba9af64df07

Config options: centralize utils libvirt options (5)

The config options of the "nova.conf" section "libvirt" got
moved to the new central location "nova/conf/libvirt.py".
Subsequent patches will then move another options in libvirt section.
This is the 5th patch in a long-chain patchs.

Change-Id: Iba3a4a487b73eb09fe67988e614c4811514e932f
Co-Authored-by: Markus Zoeller <mzoeller@de.ibm.com>
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

commit_message:
Developer Reference: Adopt the openstackdocstheme

To allow for our developer reference to be consistent with
the rest of the openstack documentation, we need to import
and render this theme on our developer reference.

This gives users a consistent experience as they may
be acquainted with the rest of the OpenStack documentation
(Admin Guide, User Guide, API Guide etc.)
before perusing the Manila developer reference.

It also provides our devref the "log-a-bug" feature so
readers may bring any mis-information to our attention.

This patch is part of a series of commits to improve
in-tree documentation.

Change-Id: I0e4686a273c5bf45c1d57764cd4c312870b06d6e
Partially-implements: bp improve-manila-developer-docs

Currently the VMDK driver does not support creating volumes

commit_message:
VMware: Support for paraVirtual image adapter type

Currently the VMDK driver does not support creating volumes
with paraVirtual adapter type. It fails the copy image to
volume operation if the image's 'vmware_adaptertype' property
is set to 'paraVirtual'. This patch adds the paraVirtual
adapter type to the list of valid adapter types to fix this.

Closes-bug: #1578399
Change-Id: I981b1737974ae1fbb3eb3fef3811bcb50030d670

commit_message:
Trove client didn't have release notes in mitaka

When I submitted [1] I was under the mistaken impression that
python-troveclient didn't have release notes in liberty but did in
mitaka. I was wrong, the commit adding releasenotes for
python-troveclient went in in c8f0af0 (April 13) while Mitaka was
3c71e52 on March 8th.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/311517/1

Change-Id: I28d15552feb0c697d49e4146a1d6156bfd0b57dc

commit_message:
Add Period to hibernate notification method

Created a new constructor including the new field. We have both
so we can support with or without passing in the period
which will help us with supporting the old API and the new API.

Once the transition occurs with the new API will remove the old
constructor

Change-Id: Idf0db02f51762633db6ccb60eeca2eb780c70e29

subject: Use slurp to collect the keystone ssh keys
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-05 10:06:36.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_key_populate.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_key_distribute.yml'], 'message': 'Use slurp to collect the keystone ssh keys

Extracting the ssh public key using cat and storing the result in a
fact has resulted in periodic failures in the collection of the key,
and thereafter the failure to appropriately place that key into the
authorised_keys file.

This patch changes the collection method to use the Ansible slurp
module which has been found to be more reliable.

Change-Id: Iac61518129536ce613e91ac894883440a8704998
(cherry picked from commit b030d8e2d1cc53187d56fa9e03b2266ce6196eef)
'}]
commit_message:
Use slurp to collect the keystone ssh keys

Extracting the ssh public key using cat and storing the result in a
fact has resulted in periodic failures in the collection of the key,
and thereafter the failure to appropriately place that key into the
authorised_keys file.

This patch changes the collection method to use the Ansible slurp
module which has been found to be more reliable.

Change-Id: Iac61518129536ce613e91ac894883440a8704998
(cherry picked from commit b030d8e2d1cc53187d56fa9e03b2266ce6196eef)

commit_message:
Removed XML request/response for cinder

In reference of cinder BP for removing xml API implementation,
this patchset removes XML request/responses.
Cinder BP - https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/remove-xml-api

Change-Id: Ic353e0e87f9973cc328fe5ab4fc7924ac8062009

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-26 10:58:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Use of metadata id instead of metadata name

If multiple metadata entries are present with same name
but different cases, 'metadata delete' command deletes all
of them irrespective of case.

For ex, "nova meta {server} delete ABC=123"
will delete all image-metadata entries with name abc, ABC, Abc etc.

This is fixed by using id instead of name to fetch metadata details
during 'nova meta {server} delete' command execution flow.

Change-Id: I2687bb7e45da1106a2fc39f6cd9335dc7622adfa
Closes-Bug: #1535224
'}]
commit_message:
Use of metadata id instead of metadata name

If multiple metadata entries are present with same name
but different cases, 'metadata delete' command deletes all
of them irrespective of case.

For ex, "nova meta {server} delete ABC=123"
will delete all image-metadata entries with name abc, ABC, Abc etc.

This is fixed by using id instead of name to fetch metadata details
during 'nova meta {server} delete' command execution flow.

Change-Id: I2687bb7e45da1106a2fc39f6cd9335dc7622adfa
Closes-Bug: #1535224

subject: Add pycrypto explicitly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-06 04:56:11.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Add pycrypto explicitly

Running "tox -e pip-missing-reqs" was broken around the
time of the Mitaka release and we missed this requirement.

nova/crypto.py:29 dist=pycrypto module=Crypto.PublicKey.RSA

Essentially, since we are constrained using upper-constraints.txt
and the upper-constraints.txt has an entry for pycrypto, we
do not see a problem anywhere.

The dependency was introduced in:
If88beeb3983705621fe736995939ac20b2daf1f3

Closes-Bug: #1578047
Change-Id: I12978a6ca49524aa2256930617a259023e6908eb
(cherry picked from commit 82b525f1fa3d279bc2558a941067d0f02b60fac2)
'}]
commit_message:
Add pycrypto explicitly

Running "tox -e pip-missing-reqs" was broken around the
time of the Mitaka release and we missed this requirement.

nova/crypto.py:29 dist=pycrypto module=Crypto.PublicKey.RSA

Essentially, since we are constrained using upper-constraints.txt
and the upper-constraints.txt has an entry for pycrypto, we
do not see a problem anywhere.

The dependency was introduced in:
If88beeb3983705621fe736995939ac20b2daf1f3

Closes-Bug: #1578047
Change-Id: I12978a6ca49524aa2256930617a259023e6908eb
(cherry picked from commit 82b525f1fa3d279bc2558a941067d0f02b60fac2)

subject: Update SHAs and config templates
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-05 16:21:53.000000000', 'files': ['templates/gnocchi-api-paste.ini.j2', 'ext/repo_packages/openstack_gnocchi.yml', 'templates/policy.json.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Update SHAs and config templates

The role has not been updated to the current pattern for independent
roles, to track master of the OpenStack role in test. This steps up
through about 3 months of development in Gnocchi, and includes the
necessary changes to paste and policy files to make Gnocci run as
expected while still including the healthcheck middleware which is
not included upstream.

During bootstrap/migration of the DB we now need to ensure that the
create-legacy-resource-types switch is given to ensure that these
are available to Ceilometer. The behavior has changed in Gnocchi to
require this for storage of standard metrics from Ceilometer.

Change-Id: I7f3cdd58bbee5bbb1704bf710397ca2ee390f03f
'}]
commit_message:
Update SHAs and config templates

The role has not been updated to the current pattern for independent
roles, to track master of the OpenStack role in test. This steps up
through about 3 months of development in Gnocchi, and includes the
necessary changes to paste and policy files to make Gnocci run as
expected while still including the healthcheck middleware which is
not included upstream.

During bootstrap/migration of the DB we now need to ensure that the
create-legacy-resource-types switch is given to ensure that these
are available to Ceilometer. The behavior has changed in Gnocchi to
require this for storage of standard metrics from Ceilometer.

Change-Id: I7f3cdd58bbee5bbb1704bf710397ca2ee390f03f

commit_message:
Reduce python-openstackclient to 1.7.2

The current u-c for python-openstackclient is 2.0.0 which
requires oslo.config>=2.7.0. That requirement cannot be met
due to the changes introduced in
I121b8b53cecc85d9e1a511a0d673e8f0a3cc24d8.

Change-Id: Icea4cb2ac3229a65d010594c03c7fbbe4c8e2d72

commit_message:
Enable new LBaaS panel in Horizon

The new LBaaS v2 panel for Horizon in Mitaka and Newton is installed
as a plugin. This patch enables the plugin as long as
`horizon_enable_neutron_lbaas` is set to True. The reference to the
older built-in LBaaS dashboard has been removed since it only works
with LBaaS v1.

Release notes are included with the patch.

Depends-On: I2d5300d4d5b02df3351ab52b1be32dd60241d34b
Change-Id: I2b1d77983598fb14fbf9ff7f23870cf767135811

view it is a remote file system storage similar to NFS or GlusterFS.

A third-party vzstorage-ci system is running testing jobs on nova

CI wiki page:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/Virtuozzo_Storage_CI

Change-Id: Ide2c952c577b36ad1b7f72012336f300f2f3331c
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: support for virtozzo storage volume driver

The purpose of this spec is to add a support for volumes hosted
by Virtuozzo storage.

Virtuozzo Storage is a fault-tolerant distributed storage system
optimized for virtualization workloads. From client's point of
view it is a remote file system storage similar to NFS or GlusterFS.

A third-party vzstorage-ci system is running testing jobs on nova
changes.

CI wiki page:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/Virtuozzo_Storage_CI

blueprint libvirt-vzstorage-volume-support

Previously-approved: Mitaka

Change-Id: Ide2c952c577b36ad1b7f72012336f300f2f3331c

commit_message:
Enable IPv6 support in Horizon

This patch creates a variable to control IPv6 support in Horizon.

This is almost the same as I4133d97f3a0aa4886b4b6f6ca3d6fb151231b0ef
that went into the master branch, but with one change: IPv6 support in
Horizon is disabled by default in this patch for stable/mitaka (to
reduce the amount of change in a stable branch). The remainder of the
patch is the same as the patch in master.

Release notes are included.

Change-Id: I4133d97f3a0aa4886b4b6f6ca3d6fb151231b0ef

subject: Add support to tune the keystone apache MPM settings
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-04 15:50:12.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/os-keystone-apache-mpm-tunable-support-1c72f2f99cd502bc.yaml', 'templates/keystone-httpd-mpm.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/keystone_apache.yml'], 'message': 'Add support to tune the keystone apache MPM settings

This fix adds support to tune the apache MPM server settings
in case more HTTP threads are needed.

New overrides have been predefined in order to use the Ubuntu
default settings:

     keystone_httpd_mpm_backend: event
     keystone_httpd_mpm_start_servers: 2
     keystone_httpd_mpm_min_spare_threads: 25
     keystone_httpd_mpm_max_spare_threads: 75
     keystone_httpd_mpm_thread_limit: 64
     keystone_httpd_mpm_thread_child: 25
     keystone_httpd_mpm_max_requests: 150
     keystone_httpd_mpm_max_conn_child: 0

Change-Id: Ieaad4d2b3c62a5b59e1fa597816ab1b4c2fc3cb1
Closes-Bug: #1576399
'}]
commit_message:
Add support to tune the keystone apache MPM settings

This fix adds support to tune the apache MPM server settings
in case more HTTP threads are needed.

New overrides have been predefined in order to use the Ubuntu
default settings:

     keystone_httpd_mpm_backend: event
     keystone_httpd_mpm_start_servers: 2
     keystone_httpd_mpm_min_spare_threads: 25
     keystone_httpd_mpm_max_spare_threads: 75
     keystone_httpd_mpm_thread_limit: 64
     keystone_httpd_mpm_thread_child: 25
     keystone_httpd_mpm_max_requests: 150
     keystone_httpd_mpm_max_conn_child: 0

Change-Id: Ieaad4d2b3c62a5b59e1fa597816ab1b4c2fc3cb1
Closes-Bug: #1576399

Grenade is an OpenStack test harness to exercise the upgrade
process between releases. It uses DevStack to perform an initial
OpenStack install and as a reference for the final configuration.

Add support of it to Manila project, doing following changes:
- Add all required scripts for 'grenade' job, such as following:
-- settings
-- shutdown.sh
-- upgrade.sh
- Add optional 'resources.sh' script that performs functional
  tests using bash and manilaclient. List of scenarios:
-- 1. create and delete share setting metadata and access rule
-- 2. attach security service to share network

-- 4. create private share type and add access for project

Change-Id: I7d7e0c50933776ca1a710bcf069abb0282b821ac
Depends-On: I4232382d3c944666bbf0916a3f285b84f6ff9d64

"}]
commit_message:
Add Grenade support to Manila

Grenade is an OpenStack test harness to exercise the upgrade
process between releases. It uses DevStack to perform an initial
OpenStack install and as a reference for the final configuration.

Add support of it to Manila project, doing following changes:
- Add all required scripts for 'grenade' job, such as following:
-- settings
-- shutdown.sh
-- upgrade.sh
- Add optional 'resources.sh' script that performs functional
  tests using bash and manilaclient. List of scenarios:
-- 1. create and delete share setting metadata and access rule
-- 2. attach security service to share network
-- 3. update quotas
-- 4. create private share type and add access for project

Note following:
- Tempest is not used by design.
- Manilaclient is used of stable version - version of 'base' devstack,
  which is 'stable/mitaka'. It also means that used API microversion
  is latest for that branch.

Change-Id: I7d7e0c50933776ca1a710bcf069abb0282b821ac
Depends-On: I4232382d3c944666bbf0916a3f285b84f6ff9d64
Implements blueprint grenade

commit_message:
Config options: centralize lvm libvirt options (4)

The config options of the "nova.conf" section "libvirt" got
moved to the new central location "nova/conf/libvirt.py".
Subsequent patches will then move another options in libvirt section.
This is the 4th patch in a long-chain patchs.

Change-Id: Iaec928d77949cae222a4c94ec0bbe445264a2012
Co-Authored-by: Markus Zoeller <mzoeller@de.ibm.com>
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

subject: Add finalise script for restorecon
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-08 13:32:56.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/nodepool-base/finalise.d/99-restorecon'], 'message': 'Add finalise script for restorecon

During the process of DIBs, for centos-7, we appear to setup improper
SELinux security contexts for /etc/hostname.  Rather then weave
through the code to figure out where we do it, add a final task to
restorecon for specific files.

This was exposed by a kolla gate job trying to update /etc/hostname
but would return the following error:

  TASK: [Assign hostname]
  failed: [node1] => {"failed": true}
  msg: Command failed rc=1, out=, err=Could not set property: Access
  denied

Change-Id: I0e699d475d8451a6edfbced7e6500eacaf7f38d3
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add finalise script for restorecon

During the process of DIBs, for centos-7, we appear to setup improper
SELinux security contexts for /etc/hostname.  Rather then weave
through the code to figure out where we do it, add a final task to
restorecon for specific files.

This was exposed by a kolla gate job trying to update /etc/hostname
but would return the following error:

  TASK: [Assign hostname]
  failed: [node1] => {"failed": true}
  msg: Command failed rc=1, out=, err=Could not set property: Access
  denied

Change-Id: I0e699d475d8451a6edfbced7e6500eacaf7f38d3
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

For now Rally always installs Tempest from the master branch. It is not

commit_message:
[Verify] Add 'version' arg to install/reinstall cmd

For now Rally always installs Tempest from the master branch. It is not
very convenient because Tempest may be broken in the master branch and
it would be very useful to use some commit or tag for Tempest.
So this commit adds a possibility to checkout the specified commit or
tag before Tempest installation.

Change-Id: Icfbb4221005466139c14d3f4aae34bbb3e013982

Add a logging option to configuration show command

This change adds the --logging option to configuration show
so the command will dump all the loggers and their log level.

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-03-25 09:10:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/ds_util.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_ds_util.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_images.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/images.py'], 'message': 'VMware: Use datastore copy when the image is already in vSphere

If glance is using the VMDK driver then the image is already located on
a vSphere datastore and it is much more efficient to fetch it using the
CopyDatastoreFile API instead doing HTTP GET from glance.

blueprint vmware-use-datastore-copy

Co-Authored-By: Cedric Brandily <zzelle@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I1cbad8c7fd1660b9df110b7ee89399f412f89d8a

commit_message:
VMware: Use datastore copy when the image is already in vSphere

If glance is using the VMDK driver then the image is already located on
a vSphere datastore and it is much more efficient to fetch it using the
CopyDatastoreFile API instead doing HTTP GET from glance.

blueprint vmware-use-datastore-copy

Co-Authored-By: Cedric Brandily <zzelle@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I1cbad8c7fd1660b9df110b7ee89399f412f89d8a

commit_message:
Trivial: Remove unuseful comments for assertRaise() checking

"Missing required args should bail here" is not understandable
and not necessary. The code is obvious enough. And some of the
comments are misused because of code copy. So remove them.

Change-Id: I031395f2c882386c7a708db5cf4eee75393dc639

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-06 05:02:32.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/api-paste.ini', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/limits.py'], 'message': 'Remove Limits dependency of legacy v2 API code

In api-paste.ini, legacy_ratelimit has been unused since the patch
I1476b2e364032d7c98f71df0cd61f1d1c19e005d. And there is a dependency
of limits module on legacy v2 API code because the legacy_ratelimit
remains.
This patch removes these code for removing the dependency.

Partially implements blueprint remove-legacy-v2-api-code

Change-Id: I4ecf1c9bd8b419769d474ddbb8116fe834199843
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Limits dependency of legacy v2 API code

In api-paste.ini, legacy_ratelimit has been unused since the patch
I1476b2e364032d7c98f71df0cd61f1d1c19e005d. And there is a dependency
of limits module on legacy v2 API code because the legacy_ratelimit
remains.
This patch removes these code for removing the dependency.

Partially implements blueprint remove-legacy-v2-api-code

Change-Id: I4ecf1c9bd8b419769d474ddbb8116fe834199843

commit_message:
release note to deprecate prevent_arp_spoofing option

This option was originally intended to deprecate in Mitaka
and remove in Newton, but we missed to announce it in Mitaka
release note. It looks better to deprecate it in Newton release
and remove it in Ocata release.

Change-Id: Iad466abbb0716da77801315d1a8766ba2f7c06b9
Closes-Bug: #1546010

revisions:
[{'number': 26, 'created': '2016-05-05 11:26:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_base.py', 'cinder/objects/base.py', 'cinder/db/api.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Add ordering possibilities to conditional update

Some DBs' update method are order dependent, and they behave differently
depending on the order of the values, example on a volume with
'available' status:

   UPDATE volumes SET previous_status=status, status='retyping'
   WHERE id='44f284f9-877d-4fce-9eb4-67a052410054';

Will result in a volume with 'retyping' status and 'available'
previous_status both on SQLite and MariaDB, but

   UPDATE volumes SET status='retyping', previous_status=status
       WHERE id='44f284f9-877d-4fce-9eb4-67a052410054';

Will yield the same result in SQLite but will result in a volume with
status and previous_status set to 'retyping' in MariaDB, which is not
what we want, so order must be taken into consideration.

This patch will allow conditional update to auto order the update
including the possibility of accepting a spefic ordering that takes
precedence over the automatic ordering.

Automatic order is as follow:

 1- Order specified in argument order
 2- Values that refer to other ORM field (simple and using operations,
    like size + 10)
 3- Values that use Case clause (since they may be using fields as well)
 4- All other values

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/232599/

Depends-On: I7de421252330fa27b0ad3cadbc4395a8f28a9dad
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: Ic3a42a5bd2c7436328dc3bf449d463e170d9f807
"}]
commit_message:
Add ordering possibilities to conditional update

Some DBs' update method are order dependent, and they behave differently
depending on the order of the values, example on a volume with
'available' status:

   UPDATE volumes SET previous_status=status, status='retyping'
   WHERE id='44f284f9-877d-4fce-9eb4-67a052410054';

Will result in a volume with 'retyping' status and 'available'
previous_status both on SQLite and MariaDB, but

   UPDATE volumes SET status='retyping', previous_status=status
       WHERE id='44f284f9-877d-4fce-9eb4-67a052410054';

Will yield the same result in SQLite but will result in a volume with
status and previous_status set to 'retyping' in MariaDB, which is not
what we want, so order must be taken into consideration.

This patch will allow conditional update to auto order the update
including the possibility of accepting a spefic ordering that takes
precedence over the automatic ordering.

Automatic order is as follow:

 1- Order specified in argument order
 2- Values that refer to other ORM field (simple and using operations,
    like size + 10)
 3- Values that use Case clause (since they may be using fields as well)
 4- All other values

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/232599/

Depends-On: I7de421252330fa27b0ad3cadbc4395a8f28a9dad
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: Ic3a42a5bd2c7436328dc3bf449d463e170d9f807

commit_message:
Move the catalog abstract base class and common code out of core

This patch moves the catalog abstract base class and common code
out of core, and into backends/base.py

This removes dependencies where backend code references code in the
core. The reasoning being that the core should know about the backend
interface, but the backends should not know anything about the core
(separation of concerns). And part of the risk here is a potential for
circular dependencies.

Change-Id: I87edf8cf660fabbc7253e6b1abc7354eef34151d
Partial-Bug: #1563101

A test was failing because the check for pool orphans was doing a
LOG.exception when there was no exception ever thrown during a unit
test, so the LOG.exception call was failing.  It doesn't make sense
for this piece of code to LOG.exception because there is no
exception being thrown, its throwing its own exception.

Change-Id: I21c12b639d05076f6c89e5c023a60526e81db5b7
Closes-Bug: #1578771
"}]
commit_message:
LBaaS V1 Log error instead of exception

A test was failing because the check for pool orphans was doing a
LOG.exception when there was no exception ever thrown during a unit
test, so the LOG.exception call was failing.  It doesn't make sense
for this piece of code to LOG.exception because there is no
exception being thrown, its throwing its own exception.

Change-Id: I21c12b639d05076f6c89e5c023a60526e81db5b7
Closes-Bug: #1578771

metadata.json.  Which means our tarballs are created as

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-22 22:13:17.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/test_decorators.py', 'tempest/config.py'], 'message': "Add generic CONF skip decorators

This commit adds two new decorators to tempest.config, skip_if_config()
and skip_unless_config(). These decorators take in a group and option
name and will either not skip or skip based on either the existence of
the option or the value of the option. This is can sometimes be
necessary in tempest plugins where there is an optional dependency on
another plugin. There isn't a good way to have tests that skip based
on the existence of config flags that might not exist. This adds a
stable interface for those plugins to rely on. This can't live in
tempest.lib because of it's dependence on tempest config, which
doesn't belong in the lib interface. But, since we provide stability
guarantees on tempest.config and tempest.test_discover.plugins to
tempest plugins this interface can be provided via tempest.config.

Change-Id: I7a5d0dfa59d6d36f0202acddebaa0a3dec119540
"}]
commit_message:
Add generic CONF skip decorators

This commit adds two new decorators to tempest.config, skip_if_config()
and skip_unless_config(). These decorators take in a group and option
name and will either not skip or skip based on either the existence of
the option or the value of the option. This is can sometimes be
necessary in tempest plugins where there is an optional dependency on
another plugin. There isn't a good way to have tests that skip based
on the existence of config flags that might not exist. This adds a
stable interface for those plugins to rely on. This can't live in
tempest.lib because of it's dependence on tempest config, which
doesn't belong in the lib interface. But, since we provide stability
guarantees on tempest.config and tempest.test_discover.plugins to
tempest plugins this interface can be provided via tempest.config.

Change-Id: I7a5d0dfa59d6d36f0202acddebaa0a3dec119540

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-02 21:43:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Fix database poison warnings, part 8

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.
This patch fixes the warnings in virt.libvirt.test_driver that come from
driver._get_connection() calls, but there are still a bunch more
warnings in that file.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: Icacce09f8a83cb4c73d5b6caf5cd31b55032c847
Related-Bug: #1568414
'}]
commit_message:
Fix database poison warnings, part 8

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.
This patch fixes the warnings in virt.libvirt.test_driver that come from
driver._get_connection() calls, but there are still a bunch more
warnings in that file.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: Icacce09f8a83cb4c73d5b6caf5cd31b55032c847
Related-Bug: #1568414

commit_message:
Use glance wrapper for nova and cinder

Make nova and cinder use glance wrapper while accessing glance. Added
update_image() to Glance wrapper for use in wait_for_*() functions.

Co-Authored-By: Srinivas Sakhamuri <srini.openstack@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Removed simple headers from documentation examples

These headers were removed from the defaults in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/293566/ - as they are already
automatically managed in accordance to the CORS specification. This
patch removes them from the example code.

Change-Id: Ic2728d65c31dcd2f6a887ce8b112f544fd5730f3

commit_message:
Use assertTrue/False instead of assertEqual(T/F)

The usage of assertEqual(True/False, ***)  cloud be
a meaningful format change to  assertTrue/False(***).
Use the specific assertion instead of the generic assertion.

Closes-Bug: #1512207

Change-Id: I45941dd82baf55b1d67aa00ea26521efe82e63f4

commit_message:
Prepare for 8.0.1 release

When we tag 8.0.0, we incorrect set the version number to 0.0.1 in
metadata.json.  Which means our tarballs are created as
puppet-mistral-0.0.1.tar.gz

Change-Id: I78d9e09112d74640f5c73ee3d2fc54197b00c009
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
repos: pin RDO to Newton & UCA to stable/mitaka

* Pin RDO to latest Newton.
* Pin UCA to stable repos for Mitaka. Canonical plans to provide Newton
  repos after OpenStack Summit in Austin.
* Install Gabbi manually, required to run Gnocchi tests.

Change-Id: Ic36fd606fe06202b0ca5b8eeaf5c5bdc2a5708fd

entry.

commit_message:
Explicitly set queue settings (nova)

Upstream puppet modules switched to
puppet-oslo usage, but they also changed
defaults. This caused unwanted changes
in behavior. Related bug is mentioned
below. This patch "restores" previous
values of message queue parameters.

Change-Id: I5cf9f697911eeef5093306dbcf66647cebcbf91d
Related-bug: #1573592

Reference:
http://logs.openstack.org/e4/e49717dd71bbaf0e9ca2303206037edc56fbe689/post/nova-upstream-translation-update/3d5f20e/console.html#_2016-05-06_21_30_33_017

commit_message:
Really fix translations copy

We cannot create the .translation-source directory before pushing to
zanata, otherwise the zanata-cli will push the .translation-source
directory as well.

Instead collect modulenames and do copying at end.

Reference:
http://logs.openstack.org/e4/e49717dd71bbaf0e9ca2303206037edc56fbe689/post/nova-upstream-translation-update/3d5f20e/console.html#_2016-05-06_21_30_33_017

Change-Id: I21ad03d1d227964e0709ef99613eaa060fee7158

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-05 22:09:00.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/mech_driver/test_mech_openvswitch.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/mech_driver/mech_openvswitch.py'], 'message': 'Preserve backward compatibility with OVS hybrid plugging

In Liberty and before, the Neutron server never had to be
configured with a firewall driver for the OVS hybrid IPtables filtering
bridge to work. However, in Mitaka, some logic snuck in[1] that made it
so if the driver was not defined, the hybrid plugging would be disabled.
This essentially broke anyone upgrading from Liberty to Mitaka who
was using OVS and did not have the firewall driver configured on the

server to automatically set hyrbid plugging to true to preserve the
Liberty behavior.

1. I13e5cda8b5f3a13a60b14d80e54f198f32d7a529

Closes-Bug: #1577584

(cherry picked from commit 7c7da2e3ca7ae4ca723fa26bda1a26d3fe95af95)
Change-Id: Ic1e316f2eb4e273e5b9fb045f1822d30af7bda68
'}]
commit_message:
Preserve backward compatibility with OVS hybrid plugging

In Liberty and before, the Neutron server never had to be
configured with a firewall driver for the OVS hybrid IPtables filtering
bridge to work. However, in Mitaka, some logic snuck in[1] that made it
so if the driver was not defined, the hybrid plugging would be disabled.
This essentially broke anyone upgrading from Liberty to Mitaka who
was using OVS and did not have the firewall driver configured on the
server.

This patch adjusts the default if the driver is not defined on the
server to automatically set hyrbid plugging to true to preserve the
Liberty behavior.

1. I13e5cda8b5f3a13a60b14d80e54f198f32d7a529

Closes-Bug: #1577584

(cherry picked from commit 7c7da2e3ca7ae4ca723fa26bda1a26d3fe95af95)
Change-Id: Ic1e316f2eb4e273e5b9fb045f1822d30af7bda68

commit_message:
VPNaaS returns 500 INTERNAL error with long names, descriptions

Should be verifying length at REST boundary to return more
reasonable 400 class user error, both because under user control
and because more meaningful to the user error message.

Closes-Bug: #1558306
Change-Id: I44a64d841e61b4f7f6872124a8f6242c4c96cf44
(cherry picked from commit 0067e2671d1c33e630dff947ac7090c370152225)

subject: crypto - align cryptography version requirement with global
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-06 08:52:19.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'crypto - align cryptography version requirement with global

The global requirements for cryptography lib was changed [1]
so bring our requirements in line with that.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/295344

commit_message:
Move the resource abstract base class out of core

This patch moves the resource abstract base class and other backend
code out of core and into backends/base.py

This removes dependencies where backend code references code in the
core. The reasoning being that the core should know about the backend
interface, but the backends should not know anything about the core
(separation of concerns). And part of the risk here is a potential for
circular dependencies.

Partial-Bug: #1563101

Change-Id: Id14d698fa7e083e72c463732e227726448a86f6d

commit_message:

Since babel 2.3 the domain can be set to a space separated list of
domains. This is necessary to compile all po files in projects that
have split up their translations in several files.

commit_message:
Fix the bug when some value in labels has comma, it will fail.

Now using 'comma' split the labels list result in the fail when some
value in labels list has comma, for example, mesos_slave_isolation=
docker/runtime,filesystem/linux

The patch fix the bug that some value in labels list has comma will
fail.

Change-Id: I1553b512e4e2efa7677efadf44e959f1601d39ad
Closes-Bug: #1578498

commit_message:
Allow for specifying green threaded to parallel engine

Currently when a string is passed to the parallel engine
it will only know how to create a process or a native thread
based executor. The futurist library also supports making
a green thread based executor, so support creating it.

This will save glance some code that they have to create
a executor based on different options (one of those is a
green option).

Change-Id: I15c164a38b4445d28eb6062aed6c56cce0e0364b

commit_message:
Make conductor.stop stop the running engine gracefully

Previously stopping the conductor would only prevent it from
accepting new jobs.  This change makes it abort the current job
by telling the engine to stop processing tasks after the current
ones finish.

This allows for conductors to gracefully exit when receiving a kill
signal (although the signal handling is not done automatically yet).

Change-Id: Ie6ddcbb2df4508ad1e3f6698c6f4cb2fc26a278f

subject: Attempt to cancel active futures when suspending is underway
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-03 22:49:03.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/builder.py'], 'message': 'Attempt to cancel active futures when suspending is underway

Instead of waiting on futures to complete that may still be
in an executors backlog (aka, not even started yet) we can
avoid even executing (and waiting on these to finish) by
forcing them to be cancelled and handling this when analyzing
the futures result (by doing nothing with the cancelled result
of a future).

This saves some time when doing suspension with executors that
have a very small pool of workers that actually run tasks/atoms.

Change-Id: Ie79466c44ac6af5ff8936f192ebce4428aa12d98
'}]
commit_message:
Attempt to cancel active futures when suspending is underway

Instead of waiting on futures to complete that may still be
in an executors backlog (aka, not even started yet) we can
avoid even executing (and waiting on these to finish) by
forcing them to be cancelled and handling this when analyzing
the futures result (by doing nothing with the cancelled result
of a future).

This saves some time when doing suspension with executors that
have a very small pool of workers that actually run tasks/atoms.

Change-Id: Ie79466c44ac6af5ff8936f192ebce4428aa12d98

subject: MySQL OCF RA to not chose all-zero-uuid as possible masters
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 14200, 'name': 'Maksim Malchuk', 'email': 'maksim.malchuk@gmail.com', 'username': 'mmalchuk'}, {'_account_id': 17730, 'name': 'Maciej Relewicz', 'email': 'mrelewicz@mirantis.com', 'username': 'mrelewicz'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-06 09:59:37.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/mysql-wss'], 'message': 'MySQL OCF RA to not chose all-zero-uuid as possible masters

Select possible masters from nodes with non zero uuids and fall back
to zero ids if only no more meaningfull ids were found.

For example, if 4 nodes have 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000,
and 5th has ef3c5d28-1045-11e6-941c-82b1df28ba4c, chose the latter
and ignore a majority of zero uuids. Otherwise, the possible master
may not be always found as crm_simulate may return negative score
for all candidates with zero ids.

Related-bug: #1576244

Change-Id: I0a5108cb6ceb6ef869d89f4993897390c8f4c749
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
MySQL OCF RA to not chose all-zero-uuid as possible masters

Select possible masters from nodes with non zero uuids and fall back
to zero ids if only no more meaningfull ids were found.

For example, if 4 nodes have 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000,
and 5th has ef3c5d28-1045-11e6-941c-82b1df28ba4c, chose the latter
and ignore a majority of zero uuids. Otherwise, the possible master
may not be always found as crm_simulate may return negative score
for all candidates with zero ids.

Related-bug: #1576244

Change-Id: I0a5108cb6ceb6ef869d89f4993897390c8f4c749
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
compute: Retain instance metadata for 'evacuate' on shared storage

When performing instance evacuation (which is essentially "rebuild an
instance elsewhere"), image metadata is not persistent -- this manifests
only when instances are on shared storage.

So, supply the original instance metadata to 'image_meta' parameter,
instead of an empty dict.

Change-Id: Ibea4954c149b9dcb162c5962ab8e9a4f17e51a1d
Co-Authored-By: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: 1562681

subject: Improve pot publishing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-06 20:53:45.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/upstream_translation_update.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/common_translation_update.sh'], 'message': "Improve pot publishing

Some projects like horizon have several modules and each contains the
same pot file, just in different locations:
* horizon/locale/djangojs.pot
* horizon/locale/django.pot
* openstack_dashboard/locale/djangojs.pot
* openstack_dashboard/locale/django.pot

so, the previous logic copied all in the exact same directory, just
resulting only in one of each - and not both.

Change the logic to use exactly same path for publishing. This is also
the path that is shown for each file in Zanata, so it's easy to
recognize and consistent accross git repository, Zanata and
tarballs.openstack.org.
Instead of a final find, run find only in the modules that we handle.

So, files are published to:
tarballs.openstack.org/translation-source/horizon/master/horizon/locale/djangojs.pot
etc

Change-Id: I2b5f6383b2d918ffdbbf4adc1dcccd06d721c65f
"}]
commit_message:
Improve pot publishing

Some projects like horizon have several modules and each contains the
same pot file, just in different locations:
* horizon/locale/djangojs.pot
* horizon/locale/django.pot
* openstack_dashboard/locale/djangojs.pot
* openstack_dashboard/locale/django.pot

so, the previous logic copied all in the exact same directory, just
resulting only in one of each - and not both.

Change the logic to use exactly same path for publishing. This is also
the path that is shown for each file in Zanata, so it's easy to
recognize and consistent accross git repository, Zanata and
tarballs.openstack.org.
Instead of a final find, run find only in the modules that we handle.

So, files are published to:
tarballs.openstack.org/translation-source/horizon/master/horizon/locale/djangojs.pot
etc

Change-Id: I2b5f6383b2d918ffdbbf4adc1dcccd06d721c65f

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-18 06:30:02.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/identity/v3/base.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/loading/test_conf.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/identity/test_identity_v3.py', 'keystoneauth1/identity/v2.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/identity/test_identity_v2.py'], 'message': "Make version optional for auth_url

If the user has specified a versioned auth type, it is evident what
version they are targeting, so we don't need to require a version
string in the URL. This patch updates the v2 and v3 Password
constructors to check whether the user has specified a version in the
URL and to append the right version if not. This circumvents doing any

Closes-bug: #1489927
"}]
commit_message:
Make version optional for auth_url

If the user has specified a versioned auth type, it is evident what
version they are targeting, so we don't need to require a version
string in the URL. This patch updates the v2 and v3 Password
constructors to check whether the user has specified a version in the
URL and to append the right version if not. This circumvents doing any
endpoint discovery and just makes reasonable assumptions based on the
user's input.

Change-Id: I50686561d4ae5538c207eb39b8c4d911d886b1c4
Closes-bug: #1489927

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-25 09:41:42.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/cmd/init.py'], 'message': 'Add option to tempest init to show global conf dir

Due to the fun and nondeterminism that is python packaging knowing
where tempest thinks the global state dir which is used to preseed
the local etc/ directory can be a complete mystery. To address this
issue this commit adds a new option to tempest init that will print
where this directory is and then exit. So in the off case you want
to preseed your local tempest working directories you can use this
to figure out where to put the files.

Change-Id: I07128fb802a6c1408d4f6154c68004b38aaf1860
'}]
commit_message:
Add option to tempest init to show global conf dir

Due to the fun and nondeterminism that is python packaging knowing
where tempest thinks the global state dir which is used to preseed
the local etc/ directory can be a complete mystery. To address this
issue this commit adds a new option to tempest init that will print
where this directory is and then exit. So in the off case you want
to preseed your local tempest working directories you can use this
to figure out where to put the files.

Change-Id: I07128fb802a6c1408d4f6154c68004b38aaf1860

subject: Reclaim isolated .meta files
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-04 16:11:02.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'message': 'Reclaim isolated .meta files

It is possible for an object dir to contain only
a .meta file*, and currently this file will never
be deleted. This patch changes the diskfile on disk
file processing to identify any isolated meta files
and mark them as ready to be reclaimed, so that the
cleanup will reclaim them if they are older than
reclaim age.

*An isolated .meta can occur as follows:

Consider two replicas of the same object whose ondisk files
have diverged due to failures:

  A has t2.ts
  B has t1.data, t4.meta

(The DELETE at t2 did not make it to B. The POST at t4 was
rejected by A.)

After ssync replication the two ondisk file sets will be:

  A has t2.ts
  B has t2.ts, t4.meta

Once t2 becomes older than (current time - reclaim age) we are
left with:

  B has t4.meta

Closes-Bug: #1534685
Change-Id: I3a175fd948a331d08df1b28f9831d7529216c6f1
'}]
commit_message:
Reclaim isolated .meta files

It is possible for an object dir to contain only
a .meta file*, and currently this file will never
be deleted. This patch changes the diskfile on disk
file processing to identify any isolated meta files
and mark them as ready to be reclaimed, so that the
cleanup will reclaim them if they are older than
reclaim age.

*An isolated .meta can occur as follows:

Consider two replicas of the same object whose ondisk files
have diverged due to failures:

  A has t2.ts
  B has t1.data, t4.meta

(The DELETE at t2 did not make it to B. The POST at t4 was
rejected by A.)

After ssync replication the two ondisk file sets will be:

  A has t2.ts
  B has t2.ts, t4.meta

Once t2 becomes older than (current time - reclaim age) we are
left with:

  B has t4.meta

Closes-Bug: #1534685
Change-Id: I3a175fd948a331d08df1b28f9831d7529216c6f1

commit_message:
Adjust region name for images, networks and volumes during deployment

In a multiregion installation of devstack, conflicts occur in the
creation of images, networks, or volume types, when the region is not
set.

This patch adjusts commands to include the region, and
also adjusts the region_name in the nova configuration section of
neutron.conf to include the region.

Change-Id: Ifedff6a124fa49d57cc7b2f35916d8d96f5e5f7a

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8392, 'name': 'Aleksey Kasatkin', 'email': 'akasatkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aleksey'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10391, 'name': 'Ihor Kalnytskyi', 'email': 'ihor@kalnytskyi.com', 'username': 'ikalnitsky'}, {'_account_id': 10443, 'name': 'Fedor Zhadaev', 'email': 'fzhadaev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fzhadaev'}, {'_account_id': 10959, 'name': 'Alexander Kislitsky', 'email': 'akislitsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akislitsky'}, {'_account_id': 11898, 'name': 'Alexander Saprykin', 'email': 'cutwatercore@gmail.com', 'username': 'asaprykin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-15 15:53:15.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/objects/node.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_node_handler.py'], 'message': "Accept interfaces changes only in discovery/error

By our design we accept changes to node interfaces only if node in
DISCOVERY and ERROR states. There are few reasons why we're doing so,
including one that IP addresses are assigned to bridges, not to NICs
and we ignore it in order to be able to redeploy nodes.

However, there's one case when node status is *artificially* changing
to ERROR state, implicitly allowing to accept interfaces changes. The
case is:

* Admin (PXE) interface is down on a node.
* nailgun-agent sends wrong node's IP address that will be used to
  check whether it belongs to Admin (PXE) network or not.
* If it doesn't belong, change node status to ERROR.
* Since the status is ERROR, changes to interfaces are allowed.
* Move admin network to another interface, which is wrong since
  physical connection wasn't changed.

The commit introduces additional condition when the check for belonging
to Admin (PXE) network is allowed.

Change-Id: I17e87e27d846921d6f0da535b9446e716449db95
Closes-Bug: #1532823
"}]
commit_message:
Accept interfaces changes only in discovery/error

By our design we accept changes to node interfaces only if node in
DISCOVERY and ERROR states. There are few reasons why we're doing so,
including one that IP addresses are assigned to bridges, not to NICs
and we ignore it in order to be able to redeploy nodes.

However, there's one case when node status is *artificially* changing
to ERROR state, implicitly allowing to accept interfaces changes. The
case is:

* Admin (PXE) interface is down on a node.
* nailgun-agent sends wrong node's IP address that will be used to
  check whether it belongs to Admin (PXE) network or not.
* If it doesn't belong, change node status to ERROR.
* Since the status is ERROR, changes to interfaces are allowed.
* Move admin network to another interface, which is wrong since
  physical connection wasn't changed.

The commit introduces additional condition when the check for belonging
to Admin (PXE) network is allowed.

Change-Id: I17e87e27d846921d6f0da535b9446e716449db95
Closes-Bug: #1532823

commit_message:
Automatically increment the patch ver with sources-branch-updater

With each SHA bump the release patch version needs to be incremented
to ensure that the repo build process uses the correct folder name.

This implements an automated update of the appropriate file to make
that happen when the sources-branch-updater is executed.

Change-Id: Ide700f1c474adb9dd4bbe7a5f8d541e5e21d9fcc

commit_message:

Return success if SST detected, otherwise check status
and return error if it is not OK.

Closes-bug: #1574999
